title: Mi Q1 138.8 cm (55 inch) QLED Ultra HD (4K) Smart Android TV

product_specification.In The Box: 1Led tv,1URemote Control,1UManual& Warranty Card 1U Stand 2U Screws 4U
product_specification.Other Video Features: Dynamic Noise reduction, Color Temperature Control, 5 Picture Mode (Standard, Movie, Vivid, Sport, Custom)
product_specification.Supported Audio Formats: Dolby Audio, MP3, FLAC, AMR, DTS, ADPCM, AAC, OGG, WMA, WAV
product_specification.Other Audio Features: 5 Equalizer - Standard, News, Movie, Game, Custom, 5 Band Equalizer
product_specification.Other Remote Control Features: Quick Wake, Quick Settings, Quick Mute
product_specification.Other Convenience Features: Optical, Bluetooth Version - 5.0, Ultra Bright UHD Display, Patchwall, Google Voice Button in Remote, Technical Superiority with VP9-10 Codec for 4K Videos
product_specification.Warranty Summary: 1 Year on Product and 1 Additional Year for Panel From Mi
product_specification.Not Covered in Warranty: Warranty Does Not Cover Any External Accessories (Such as Battery, Cable, Carrying Bag), Damage Caused to the Product Due to Improper Installation by Customer, Normal Wear and Tear and Damages Caused to the Product by Accident, Lightening, Ingress of Water, Fire, Dropping or Excessive Shock, Any Damage Caused Due to Tampering of the Product by an Unauthorized Agent.
product_specification.Installation & Demo Details: 1. Covered Under Standard Installation - Table Mounting Using Standard Stand Supplied as Accessory with TV - Extra Charges are Applicable for Wall Mounts as, Rs. 399 for 32 inch Display Size and Rs. 499 for >32 inch Display Size - Connecting with Available Power Source (within 1 Meter) - Connecting / Setting Up Various Available Input Source for Audio Video Based on Model - Connecting with Available WiFi (for Smart TV) - Checking TV for Proper Functioning - Demonstration of the TV and its Features

product_description.Premium Aluminium Frame: The QLED Display with 4K resolution offers an impressive and crystal-clear visual experience.
product_description.Dolby Vision: The Dolby Vision offers vibrant colours and impressive details to deliver life-like visuals.

Worthy Qled TV

Trust Mi just go for it. The clarity, sharpness and quality is excellent and one more thing never compare Qled TV with other brands because this is what the best we get at this price range.

Coming to the sound I would rate 3/5, its OK if you are not a bass lover.

Considering the price one of the best value for money TV you can buy in present market. The TV lags, it needs software improvement. The sound quality is ok. The options to change sound settings are very limited. I don't see those deep blacks MI was telling during launch. The video quality is nice but it is not up to mark for a Qled when compared to samsung. If anyone can suggest best settings for video and audio please share. The far field mic doesn't work. I have to always press google assistant button on remote to make to listen to me. I guess we can expect a software update from MI soon fixing the issues. Overall I would say a good buy if u are looking for big 75 inch tv in budget go for it. U won't be dissatisfied.

This is a very good Qled panel. The brightness (not mentioned) is pretty great, no issues while watching it in bright conditions. The panel is not very reflective, which is definitely a plus point. One of the best value for money TV's in the market right now. Support for dual band WiFi is just great. Patchwall makes it easier to navigate and search for new content. Android 10 is also phenomenal, overall a very fluid UI, no complaints. The sound is amazing too! Clear vocals and proper frequency seperation, thanks to Dolby Audio. Last but not the least, the build is amazing with the aluminium frame running along the edges and an almost bezel-less design gives it a very premium and modern look. 10/10 would recommend.

I bought this Tv for my dad. It was his dream to have a big screen in home. I was skeptical first but I am super happy with the quality that comes from the TV. The only con I could see is the sound but that’s fine when you compare with the pricing. Get a sound bar from JBL will substitute the sound. Image quality is mind blowing. I played Spider-Man, need for speed heat, GTA V and god of war, they are just incredible. I personally recommend to go for this TV.

Great TV
Picture quality and sound are top quality.
About performance, better smoothness switching between apps compared to other. Good enough storage.

Writting this review post 10 days of usage, having upgraded from Samsung LCD 32, my initial expression "Mind Blowing".. I'm not going to compare it with other QLED's with high prize tag-list.. MI has done a fab of a work on the sound, built & picture quality. Comparing it for the features on offer with minimalistic design, this is a steal of a deal.

Most important of all the ecosystem to consolidate the contents is the big game changer. Giving a 5/5 for sound; 5/5 for built; 5/5 connectivity; 4/5 for picture.

Value for money
I have been using the TV for almost a week and I can say go for it if you wish to upgrade from led tvs.

Excellent TV! Don't think about it, just buy it.

Would definitely recommend it over -
Redmi X55, MI TV4X, and other LED TVs from Vu, Hisense, LG, Samsung (overpriced).

My main criteria for getting this was -
Better colours, deeper blacks.

So does it actually show better colours and deeper blacks when compared to other LED TVs?

Absolutely! The colours are at least 10-12% more vibrant compared to normal LED TVs, and the black uniformity is excellent as well. There's no unnecessary grey spread.

Many TVs out there say they have Wide Color Gamut, but how much? Most LED TVs provide 85-92% NTSC colour space. This covers 100% of that, which means it covers all visible colours (I guess). The picture looks crisp (4k), colour volume is great, and deeper blacks ensures excellent contrast.
It's still not OLED level blacks, but much much better than Redmi TVs, where many TVs have a very high light bleed issue, and in dark scenes the picture looks outright grey. Thankfully not on this TV, black looks like black and that makes it the best TV under 60k for use in bedrooms which are usually kept dark.

I was confused about this with Redmi X55, Vu TVs, but the additional 15k over normal LED TV is with it since you buy a TV to keep it for at least 5-6 years, so you should buy the absolute best picture quality keeping your budget in mind.

My first choice was an OLED TV but super expensive, second choice was Samsung QLED, excellent but again expensive and based on Tizen, so MI gives you the best for the price.

I would have added images for dimming test and 4k videos, but trust me, it won't be accurate. You need to see it to understand it.

Will start with the cons, as pros are widely reported anyways:

1. Mi Quick Mute feature (double tap on volume down button to mute) doesn't work. Checked with another friend, same issue. A feature advertised on their website should work out of the box. Right now, to mute, I need to keep the volume down button pressed for at least 2 to 3 seconds, which is very inconvenient.
Rest of the additional features like quick wake, quick access work as expected.

2. Motion smoothing is a hit and miss. When it works, its an excellent feature. But sometimes in apps like Disney and prime video, it stutters during fast paced scenes. Hence, I have kept it off.

3. UI is sometimes laggy. For eg. occasionally on pressing the home button from inside an app, it takes like 4 to 5 seconds to respond. I have used MiBox4 before this, and the UI there was very fluid and responsive.

All these issues can be fixed via software. Apparently there was an OTA update which was rolled out a few months back for the quick mute issue, but it was rolled back.
The software team should release an update soon to fix these issues, as the rest of the hardware is great, and the experience is a bit of a let down due to the software.

4. (Not directly related to the TV) Delivery was on time, but installation by Flipkart was done after 6 days. For 6 days, the big 55 inch box had to be kept in my house, which was troublesome. Installation for such a high value product shouldn't take more than 2 or 3 days.

Pros:

1. Picture quality, sound quality is awesome.

2. Motion smoothing looks great for watching sports.

3. Build quality seems good. Ports are easily accessible.

3. 32GB internal storage with approximately 25GB usable space comes handy, as external 4k x265 files are usually at least 10 to 15GB for 2 hour content.

TL;DR: Great hardware, below par software, which could catch up with an update, but don't count on it while making your decision. Buy for what it is when you buy.

If you really want to enjoy this tv, I think you should purchase a streaming device such as fire-stick 4k.

The purchase and delivery was quick. The installation was done by a polite technician and handled well.
The TV is a good step up to the ordinary UHD TVs but a shade below the more expensive models of Sony, Samsung etc.
For my purpose the TV has good picture colour and clarity, Looks nice on the wall and works well with my soundbar. The two features that I wanted and got in this model over other budget QLEDs is eARC and dual band with 5Ghz support.
The remote is disappointing but tolerable. Haven't explored all features (patchwall) as it's mainly used for Netflix/Prime and I get Dolby vision, UHD/4K picture and Dolby DD+ surround sound on my JBL 9.1 soundbar. Surprisingly the inbuilt apps don't offer Dolby atmos. Checked this with Amazon's firestick and found better picture resolution and Atmos sound, which the in built apps don't provide. So if it's hooked to your AV HT, then better to avoid in built apps for movies for 7.1/Dolby Atmos effects.
Overall, a good purchase for budget conscious and brand indifferent TV customers.

Detailed review after 6 months use (only Ott content as I do not use standard tv connection)

The best TV in the price segment. Picture quality is unmatched. Clear and evident difference in the quality between Mi LED and QLed. This has very deep blacks and high crisp picture. Please note you will be able to enjoy the benefits only on Ott platforms and not on standard set top box. If u use majority of set top box then go for regular led instead of QLed.

Pros:
1. Picture quality undoubtedly.. it recognises Dolby vision content from Netflix and hotstar, HDR10+ separately from prime and plays them perfectly.
2. Sound is also adequately loud enough. I use soundboard which also can connect Dolby Atmos using eArc which is very rare at this price point.
3. Apps, it has play store so has access to almost all the apps.
4. The frame of this tv is so classy and almost looks like Basel less display. Super rich look.
5. High connectivity options and futuristic.

Cons:
Nothing major till now. Initially had very bad picture quality while watching Dolby vision content, it showed patches all over but later rectified through software update. Now perfect.

This is the best see this price point, but can enjoy the picture quality benefits only on Ott apps. If you are av standard stb used them don't waste additional money on this.

As compared to the other of Sonu and samsung this is perfect LED value for money but sound is good but we can use additional speakers 4 better result

Then also it will be cheaper compare to other

PRO's:

1. value for money
2. excellent picture quality
3. very good design and build quality

CON's:
1. sound quality is not good sometimes. even after maxing the volume, audio is not clear
2. a USB port is not working sometimes (should be a fault with my specific piece)
3. unable to change the picture mode to sport, movie directly while watching prime video or youtube. we have to exit the application and go to settings to change it. Whereas the options is available under the video while watching offline videos
4. slight lag on times while watching a 4k UHD video offline (via HDD / Pen-drive)
2. slow startup. takes almost 60secs to start the TV
3. a dedicated app like onePlus connect to search in TV would be really helpful

Memory used in the TV is always greater than 60-70%. This means that out of 2gb ram, approx 1.5gb is occupied by system which is a lot. RAM management should be better in the TV. Because of less user available RAM, switching between apps feels like a lag. Also the remote buttons make too much noise while pressing. MI should have provided soft button remote. Sound and picture quality is good but if you're looking for a smooth user experience then there are a lot of options out there in the market. Also, for MI there is a lot of room for improvement in this TV such as better RAM management which I hope will be pushed in a later update by Mi.

There was delay in tv installation by the Flipkart. I then got it installed by MI service people. Their service and approach was good.
I am using the tv now for 3 months and following is the review.
1. Android opareting system: The android operating system of tv is very slow in response. This makes moving from one menu to another sluggish, it not responsive as compared to Sony or Samsung. Mi needs to immediately look into this and must come up with an upgrade.
2. Remote : The remote is very minimalist and badly located buttons especially the mic button, one can switch off the tv when trying to press mic button. All other buttons requires effort to navigate the tv menu. Tv poor response and remote gives you very poor experience in operating the tv.
3. Voice assistance : The audio command function is buggy, tv picks up it own sound and start listening and start other menus based on what it has picked of its own. You would find in middle of a program tv suddenly stops and start listening and opens some other menu. A serious bug in tv , which needs to be fixed immediately.
4. Audio out function: The audio output level in digital pass through and pcm is so low that it is barely audible over a 200 w sound external system. One is forced to use digital Dolby out setting. Hence tv tries to convert stereo or all signal to 5.1 forcefully and does a very poor job. Auto level control for audio is also missing. Hence you would find tv sound vary between one channel to another. Hence an experienced audio listener with home theatre would not get good sound from tv as required. TVs own audio system is basic, you can not get better sound with such a thin profile of tv.
5. Operating manual: They do not have an operating manual for tv, MI india thinks that Indian customers are stupid and dump hence there is no need to supply an operating manual, they will just switch the tv on and watch, they do not understand other features of tv hence why waste money in giving them an operating manual. A 2 page leaflet comes with tv which is basically is installation guide.

All the above issues have been pointed to MI call centre more than 2 months ago but nothing has done by Mi to fix these problems. Probably by not attending the issue it self solves the problem because customers eventually lives with problem.
With all the above issues the tv rating does not goes beyond 1 star.

Positives:

1) Content looks great.

2) Software is excellent.

3) Sound from TV speakers is loud as well as good enough, but not as good as dedicated speakers of home theater.

4) Remote could have been better.

Negatives:
1) 1 negative point is, installation guy said that he is unable to connect my sound system with the TV using as it is not supporting Aux :/
But I used to connect my previous LG TV to sound system in the same way.

2) Screen cast is very laggy.

3) Not detecting when I connect my mobile for file transfer.

4) There's no batteries for remote and wall mount is not included in the box, installation guy charged 499 for standard wall mount.
Also its better to let installation technician do installation has it has something to do with warranty.

5) Peak Brightness could be negative if outside lighting is not controlled. Not a problem otherwise.

About the delivery and installation:

1) Delivery was fast but open box delivery was not performed.

2) Only positive experience with installation was that it happened the very next day to delivery.

3) Installation process was worst.
After coming to my place, the installation guy told he will charge me 250 for removing my old TV and that these are company charges. So I tried calling Mi customer care and then he immediately said he can do it free of cost.

He was unprofessional. Threw(not gently) stuff on ground and on table, Stepped on TV box!(TV was not present inside though) , Put sharp instruments like drilling machine on sofa etc.
I was afraid that he is going to break the TV with this attitude!
I guess after installation they have to take a selfie with the TV with a sanitizer in hand, but he did not bring his sanitizer, so took mine and returned after taking selfie with it in hand.

So negative stars for installation and delivery.
